state_analysis: The test script creation is still failing due to improperly formatted escape characters, leading to syntax errors when the script is run. The repeated attempts to run the script lead to the same errors.
explanation: I will recreate the test script again, ensuring that I avoid any problematic characters and properly format the script without escape sequences that cause issues. I will also use single quotes to prevent shell from interpreting the exclamation mark. After creating the script successfully, I will attempt to run it to verify the functionality of the solve function.

commands.keystrokes:
echo 'import numpy as np
from grid_transform import solve

test_input = [[8, 6], [6, 4]]

result = solve(test_input)
assert result == expected_output, f'Expected {expected_output}, but got {result}'
print("Test passed!")' > test_script.py
